subject: Re: [junit] Using jmock for testing a void method

Subject: Re: [junit] Using jmock for testing a void method

Cedric Beust wrote:
>  > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On  Behalf Of
> J. B. Rainsberger
> 
>  > > Iam having a void method.(say x())
>  > > In which it calls another void method.(say y()) I have to
>  > test whether y() is called in x() or not using jmock.
>  > > Can any one guide me to how to write the test case (programming)?
>  >
>  > JMock's web site has excellent examples. Have you tried
>  > following them?
>  >
>  > In English, we expect x() to invoke y() with some parameters,
>  > returning some value.
> 
> Since these two methods are void, this is probably not going to work.

I have no idea why that would matter. If the goal is to know whether x() 
invokes y(), it doesn't matter what they return. My suggestion stands.

Your suggestion is perfectly fine, too; a simple example of a hardcoded 
Spy version of the method y().
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
